page.title: 02Margam Forest
page.content: The conifer plantations of Mynydd Margam are part of Margam Forest owned by the Forestry Commission. Here 85% of the trees are Sitka Spruce, 12% larch and the remainder Abies grande. Mynydd Margam is dotted with tumuli and earthworks. Present is a replica of the Bodvoc stone which stands in the north east of the plantation and marks the grave of a C6th chieftain. Fallow deer which have escaped from Margam Park are widely distributed. A number of upland farms have been abandoned, Blaen Maelwg has been bulldozed, its land planted with conifers. Near large urban centres, for years it had one of the worst fire records in the country.
